Precitec.Filter.Hough.Beschreibung.Text: Detects the two clearest lines on a binary image. Result are the left and right x-coordinates of the lines found.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Hough.MinAngle.Text: Minimum normal vector angle of lines to be found. The origin of the normal vectors is located on the left in the middle of image.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Hough.MaxAngle.Text: Maximum normal vector angle of lines to be found. The origin of the normal vectors is located on the left in the middle of image.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Hough.MinLineL.Text: Minimal length of lines to be found relative to ROI height.
Minimal length of lines to be found relative to ROI height.
Minimal length of lines to be found relative to ROI height.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Hough.MinRadiu.Text: Minimal distance of lines to be found.
Minimal distance of lines to be found.
Minimal distance of lines to be found.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Hough.MaxRadiu.Text: Maximal distance of lines to be found.
Maximal distance of lines to be found.
Maximal distance of lines to be found.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Hough.SearchSt.Text: Start of line search in X. Effects only at equal line lengths

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ROISelectorTyp.Text: Set red channel of roi overlay.
Set red channel of roi overlay.
Set green channel of roi overlay.
Set green channel of roi overlay.
Set blue channel of roi overlay.
Set blue channel of roi overlay.
Set alpha channel of roi overlay.
Set alpha channel of roi overlay.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.StartEndROISel.Text: Set red channel of roi overlay.
Set red channel of roi overlay.
Set green channel of roi overlay.
Set green channel of roi overlay.
Set blue channel of roi overlay.
Set blue channel of roi overlay.
Set alpha channel of roi overlay.
Set alpha channel of roi overlay.

Precitec.Filter.EdgeSkew.Beschreibung.Text: Calculates the displacement of the blanks left and right from the seam.

Precitec.Filter.Convolution3X3.Beschreib.Text: Convolutes the image with a 3X3 filter mask. The image border values are set to zero. From the convolution result the absolute value is taken and clipped to 0-255.

Precitec.Filter.Convolution3X3.Tooltip.Text: Convolutes the image with a 3X3 filter mask. No border treatment.

Precitec.Filter.Median.Beschreibung.Text: No boundary treatment, slow at bigger filter radiuses.

Precitec.Filter.Median.Tooltip.Text: 2D median filter, no border treatment, not optimized.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.MedianTyp.Filt.Text: Filter radius to be averaged on.
Filter radius to be averaged on.

Precitec.Filter.Binarize.Beschreibung.Text: Transforms input image to binary image (only black and white pixels) by means of thresholding.

Precitec.Filter.Binarize.Tooltip.Text: Transforms input image to binary image (only black and white pixels) by means of thresholding.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Binarize.Compa.Text: Wether searched objects are darker or brighter than background.
Wether searched objects are darker or brighter than background.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Binarize.Binar.Text: For binarizing three modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Static: A fixed threshold is applied to whole image 2) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 3) Local mean image intensity plus offset: Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighborhood.

For binarizing three modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Static: A fixed threshold is applied to whole image 2) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 3) Local mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is local mean image intensity plus offset. Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighboorhood.
Global mean image intensity with offset
Local mean image intensity with offset

Precitec.Filter.BinarizeDynamic.Beschrei.Text: Transforms input image to binary image (only black and white pixels) by means of thresholding. Threshold/offset is provided by the second input pipe (see thresholding mode).

Precitec.Filter.BinarizeDynamic.Tooltip.Text: Transforms input image to binary image (only black and white pixels) by means of thresholding.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.BinarizeDynami.Text: Wether searched objects are darker or brighter than background.
Wether searched objects are darker or brighter than background.
Dark/bright objects
Search for dark objects
Search for bright objects

For binarizing three modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Static: A fixed threshold is applied to whole image 2) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 3) Local mean image intensity plus offset: Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighborhood.

For binarizing three modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Static: A fixed threshold is applied to whole image 2) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 3) Local mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is local mean image intensity plus offset. Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighboorhood.
Thresholding mode
Global mean image intensity with offset
Local mean image intensity with offset

Precitec.Filter.BinarizeDynamicOnOff.Bes.Text: Transforms input image to binary image (only black and white pixels) by means of thresholding. Threshold/offset is provided by the second input pipe (see thresholding mode).

Precitec.Filter.BinarizeDynamicOnOff.Too.Text: Transforms input image to binary image (only black and white pixels) by means of thresholding.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.BinarizeDynami.Text: Wether image will be binarized or not.
Wether image will be binarized or not.
Binarize image
Wether searched objects are darker or brighter than background.
Wether searched objects are darker or brighter than background.
Dark/bright objects
Search for dark objects
Search for bright objects

For binarizing three modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Static: A fixed threshold is applied to whole image 2) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 3) Local mean image intensity plus offset: Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighborhood.

For binarizing three modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Static: A fixed threshold is applied to whole image 2) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 3) Local mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is local mean image intensity plus offset. Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighboorhood.
Thresholding mode
Global mean image intensity with offset
Local mean image intensity with offset

Precitec.Filter.DynamicRoi.Beschreibung.Text: Allos you to generate region of interest from calculated values.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.DynamicRoiTyp..Text: Set red channel of roi overlay.
Set red channel of roi overlay.
Set green channel of roi overlay.
Set green channel of roi overlay.
Set blue channel of roi overlay.
Set blue channel of roi overlay.
Set alpha channel of roi overlay.
Set alpha channel of roi overlay.

Precitec.Filter.DynamicRoiSimple.Beschre.Text: Allows you to generate region of interest from calculated values in x direction. The y direction is set via parameter.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.DynamicRoiSimp.Text: Start value y of the roi
True: x is start value of the roi, False: x is middle of the roi (horizontal)
True: x is start value of the roi, False: x is middle of the roi (horizontal)

Precitec.Filter.StartEndDynamicRoiSimple.Text: Allows you to generate region of interest from calculated values in x direction. The y direction is set via parameter and will be for start/end images automaticaly adjusted.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.StartEndDynami.Text: Start value y of the roi

Precitec.Filter.VerticalShading.Beschrei.Text: Reskaliert die Helligkeit aller Spalten so, das alle Spalten die gleiche mittlere Helligkeit haben. Dies kann vertikale Kratzer und bestimmte Formen von Kamerarauschen vermindern.

Precitec.Filter.Morphology.Beschreibung.Text: Closes holes and removes small particels.

Precitec.Filter.Morphology.Tooltip.Text: Closes holes and removes small particels.

Precitec.Filter.TileFeature.Beschreibung.Text: Divides the image in tiles. Tiles may overlap. For every tile a texture feature (e.g. variance) is calculated. Result is a feature image.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.TileFeature.Ti.Text: Size of tiles the image is divided in.
Size of tiles the image is divided in.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.TileFeature.Ju.Text: Distance to next tile. If the distance is smaller than tile size, tiles are overlapping.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.TileFeature.Dr.Text: Values greater than threshold are painted in green, else in red.
Values greater than threshold are painted in green, else in red.

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceCalculator.Beschr.Text: Divides the image in tiles. Tiles may overlap. For every tile a set of texture features is calculated. Result is a complete set of these values.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.SurfaceCalcula.Text: Jump width in the horizontal direction
Jump width in the horizontal direction
Jump width in the vertical direction
Jump width in the vertical direction
Fit the tile size to the input ROI? (Ensure that at least one tile is computed, even if the input ROI is smaller than the tile size)
Fit the tile size to the input ROI?

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceCalculator2Rows.B.Text: Puts on the image (first ROI) one row of tiles. Then depending from the percentage vale, places a second smaller row of tiles over the first row. For every tile a set of texture features is calculated. Result is a complete set of these values. If the input image (first ROI) is smaller than the tile size, the computation is performed using the missing area from the second ROI.

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceCalculator2Rows.T.Text: Calculates surface values in two rows

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.SurfaceCalcula.Text: Jump width in the vertical direction
Jump width in the vertical direction
Width of inner row in % of main row
Width of inner row in % of main row
Fit the main tile size to the input ROI? (Ensure that one tile is computed, even if the input ROI is smaller than the tile size)
Fit the main tile size to the input ROI?

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceCalculatorAdaptIn.Text: Divides the image (first ROI) in tiles. Tiles may overlap. For every tile a set of texture features is calculated. Result is a complete set of these values. If the input image (first ROI) is smaller than the tile size, the computation is performed using the missing area from the second ROI.

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceClassifier.Beschr.Text: Gets a set of calculated surface values and determines the largest erroneous connected area.

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceClassifier.Toolti.Text: Checks surface values against given limits

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.SurfaceClassif.Text: Decides, if a 4-connected neighborhood (turn on) or a 8-connected Neighborhood is used.

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceClassifier2Rows.B.Text: Gets a set of calculated surface values and determines the largest erroneous connected area.

Precitec.Filter.SurfaceClassifier2Rows.T.Text: Checks surface values against given limits

Precitec.Filter.EdgeDetection.Beschreibu.Text: Searches edges in the image and marks the edge amlitude to a grey value.

Precitec.Filter.EdgeDetection.Tooltip.Text: Edge detection in a grey value image.

Precitec.Filter.ImageToPointList.Beschre.Text: Extracts points out of the image and offers an output as point list. The way the points are extracted is given with the mode parameter.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ImageToPointLi.Text: Mode, how the image is converted to a point list.
Mode, how the image is converted to a point list.

Precitec.Filter.CircleFit.Beschreibung.Text: Calculates a circle to a given bunch of points. This circle will be the best fitting circle to these points.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleFit.Mode.Text: Mode, how the circle is calculated. Currently not used.
Mode, how the circle is calculated.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleFit.Part.Text: This is the start percent value in x-direction.
This is the end percent value in x-direction.

Precitec.Filter.CircleFitXT.Beschreibung.Text: Calculates a circle to a given bunch of points. This circle will be the best fitting circle to these points (least squares optimization or hough transform). Input: Pointlist, MinRadius, MaxRadius, MinXCenter, MinYCenter, MaxXCenter, MaxYCenter

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleFitXT.Ho.Text: Hough Score Type: accumulator matrix score or connected arc length
Hough Score Threshold (accumulator matrix score % or connected arc length degrees)

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleFitXT.Se.Text: Search circles with center outside ROI
Search circles with center outside ROI

Precitec.Filter.CircleFitContour.Beschre.Text: Calculates for each of two point lists a best fitting circle, and calcultes out of them a 'mean' circle, who's center point and radius are set as result.

Precitec.Filter.CircleFitContour.Tooltip.Text: Calculates a 'mean' circle out of 2 point lists.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleFitConto.Text: Specifies how many points should be cut, percentage from top.
Specifies how many points should be cut, percentage from bottom.

Precitec.Filter.MeanBrightness.Beschreib.Text: Calculates the mean brightness level in the given image.

Precitec.Filter.LineShifter.Beschreibung.Text: This filter shifts lines in an image

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.LineShifter.No.Text: This value determines the line that will not be shifted. 50% means the middle of the image.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.LineShifter.Fi.Text: Gaps will be filled with this grey value

Precitec.Filter.PoorPenetration.Beschrei.Text: This filter detects a poor penetration.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.PoorPenetratio.Text: Amount of pixels above upper threshold beneath a minimum
Amount of pixels above upper threshold
Amount of pixels above upper threshold
Amount of pixels under lower threshold beneath a minimum
Amount of pixels under lower threshold
Amount of pixels under lower threshold
Maximum allowable width for a minimum

Precitec.Filter.LineEstimator.Beschreibu.Text: Estimates a line in 2D given 3 points.

Precitec.Filter.LineEstimator.Tooltip.Text: Estimates a line in 2D given 3 points.

Precitec.Filter.TimedSimpleDynamicRoi.Be.Text: Chooses a smaller ROI after a given amount of time has passed.

Precitec.Filter.TimedSimpleDynamicRoi.To.Text: Chooses a smaller ROI after a given amount of time has passed.

Precitec.Filter.MeltResult.Beschreibung.Text: Calculates some value for the quality check of a melting bath.

Precitec.Filter.LinearLut.Beschreibung.Text: Processes a linear tranformation of the image between a minimum and a maximum grey values

Precitec.Filter.ImageArithmetic.Beschrei.Text: Stateful unary arithmetic filter on images: Computes pixel operations (sum, min, max..) on the pixel of an image stack

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ImageArithmeti.Text: Operate on every n pixel in x direction
Operate on every n pixel in y direction
Number of previous frames to consider
If true, the filter does not process bad rank input images. If false, saves the image in the buffer and process it like the others
Reset stored values at seam start (True by default). Setting this value to False can be useful when in Simulation mode.
Rescale pixel intensities (avoids saturation) by applying a linear LUT between OutputMinValue and OutputMaxValue.

Precitec.Filter.CrossCorrelation.Beschre.Text: This filter computes the cross-correlation of the input image with a template. The template can be read from a file or generated according to the provided parameters. The correlation method used can be cross-correlation or normed cross-correlation. The first output is the computed image, the second output the template used (normalized). The intensity range of both output images is always 0-255 (also in the case of normed cross-correlation, otherwise it would not be possible to represent the range 0-1). The filter does not perform any padding on the input image, therefore the size of the output image will be smaller than the input image with a difference of (template size - 1), and the image position is changed such that the output image is centered. The option 'Fill Output Border' is given in order to return an image with the same size as the input. In case of error (for example pattern image not valid), a blank image with size (0,0) is returned.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CrossCorrelati.Text: Selection of the template source (from file, box, gaussian, checkered pattern). File: the template comes from a file, whose filename is specified by the user (in the folder /wm_inst/pattern, as it is saved from the pattern selection GUI). Box: the template is a rectangle (low-pass box filter), whose shape can be specified by the user. Gaussian: the template is a rotationally symmetric Gaussian lowpass filter, the user can specify sigma and size. Checkered: the template is a vichy checkered pattern, where the user can specify square size, number of repetions, gray intensity (separable filter). Default is Box

This parameter is used only when the selection of the template source is File. The integer number is parsed to get a filename of the type /wm_inst/pattern/000.bmp . If the provided filename does not exist, a warning is issued and the output is a blank image of size 0.
Filename pattern of the template image
Filename pattern of the template image
Cross-correlation: implements OpenCV TM_CCORR. Normed cross-correlation: implements OpenCV TM_CCORR_NORMED. Default is Cross-correlation
When True, a border of pixel with intensity=0 is added to the cross-correlation result, such that the output image size is equal to the input. Default is False
Return an output image of the same image as the input
Template Width. Valid if pattern source is Box, Gaussian or Checkered.
Template Width. Valid if pattern source is Box, Gaussian or Checkered.
Template Height. Valid if pattern source is Box, Gaussian (supported only if equal to height) or Checkered.
Template Height. Valid if pattern source is Box, Gaussian (supported only if equal to height) or Checkered.
Checkered pattern: the parameter represent the intensity of the top left corner of the pattern
Checkered pattern: the parameter represent the intensity of the top left corner of the pattern
Checkered pattern: the parameter represent the intensity of the bottom right corner of the pattern
Checkered pattern: the parameter represent the intensity of the bottom right corner of the pattern
Checkered pattern: the parameter represent the size of the square (pixel). If necessary, the user-specified template size is increased in order to be a multiple of the square size
Checkered pattern: the parameter represent the size of the square (pixel). If necessary, the user-specified template size is increased in order to be a multiple of the square size

This parameter is used only for templates generated by the filter itself (v.3.5, not used in succesive versions - it must be = -1). If source is Box, the parameter is rounded to provide the width of the box kernel. If source is Gaussian, the parameter represents sigma (suggested value: 0.5)

This parameter is used only for templates generated by the filter itself (v.3.5, not used in succesive versions). If source is Box, the parameter is rounded to provide the heigth of the box kernel. If source is Gaussian, the parameter represents the size (suggested value: 3)

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.TemplateMatchi.Text: Template file name and location relative to Weldmaster base directory
The first template rotation angle value
Total number of templates to be generated
Image scale down factor for fast matching
Whether to crop the invalid area caused by rotation ro not

Precitec.Filter.ShapeMatching.Beschreibu.Text: Shape Matching takes a template image as parameter input, extracts edge features from the template and matches the edge features in the input image to determine the object position.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ShapeMatching..Text: Template file name and location relative to Weldmaster base directory
Gaussian blur of template before edge extraction
Minimum threshold of edge gradient magnitude of a template. Edge pixels in the template with gradient larger than this value is considered an edge
How many times to subsample the image before performing shape matching
Define the start of angle range the template should be rotated and searched for
Define the extent of angle range the template should be rotated and searched for
Minimum matching score that a match candidate should have to be considered as a match
A speed optimization parameter. A high greediness means that the algorithm will filter out candidates with lower likelihood of being the actual target at an early stage
Maximum overlap specifies how much two match candidates are allowed to overlap with each other
The maximum number of candidates to be considered
Sort all match candidates based on score or position

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Metrology.Cont.Text: A 2xN matrix that contains the contour points
Number of sampling points used for resampling contour. 0 means no resampling

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.AngleR.Text: Total search range of the optimal angle

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.AngleS.Text: Total angle steps to search for

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.Normal.Text: Normalize the intensity profile such that profile minimum is 0 and maximum is 1

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.Sigma..Text: Sigma parameter of the edge extraction kernel. Affects the kernel size

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.MinCon.Text: Minimum amplitude of a gradient extremum in order to be considered as edge

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.PeakSe.Text: Type of edge or edge pairs to search for

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Caliper.ScoreF.Text: Math expression to define how score is calculated

Precitec.Filter.ContourProfile.Beschreib.Text: Samples an image along the normal directions of a contour

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ContourProfile.Text: Number of sample lines along the contour
Length of the sample lines in pixel

Precitec.Filter.ParallelLocalExtremum.Be.Text: For each row of image, determine all local extremums and output the selected peak position.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ParallelLocalE.Text: Type of local extremum to be searched for, maximum or minimum
When activated, Search extremum from the right of the image to the left of the image
Minimum prominence threshold for peak filtering
When activated, the peak position is refined by fitting a parabola around the coarse position
Offsets the peak position by a constant

Precitec.Filter.LineToContour.Beschreibu.Text: This filter is used together with the ContourProfile filter to get the contour of an object. The line input contains the position of each 1D measurement, which is to be combined the the original contour to get the measured contour.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.LineToContour..Text: When checked, the start and end of the output contour will be connected

Precitec.Filter.LineSmoothFFT.Beschreibu.Text: Smooth a line by filtering out high frequency component.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.LineSmoothFFT..Text: The cutoff frequency of the low pass filter

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.RangeInputMinP.Text: Set the minimum limit of of the result values sub-range used to create the output image. The pixels of the output image can only assume integer values between 0 and 255, therefore the result of the cross-correlation must be rescaled and rounded. In order to achieve a better contrast in the output image, it can be useful to set a sub-range of interest for the result values. For example in a pattern matching application, a good contrast is achieved setting a sub-range 90-100% (otherwise most of the levels of gray of the output image would be used for bad matches, and the higher matches would just appear white).
Minimum % of cross-correlation result range for output image

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.RangeInputMaxP.Text: Set the minimum limit of of the result values sub-range used to create the output image.
Maximum % of cross-correlation result range for output image

Precitec.Filter.poorPenetrationEdge.Besc.Text: Detects the two clearest lines in the hough space on a binary image. The results line length, position distance to Roi center, intersection point, max interruption and gap brightness of the found lines are transferred.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.poorPenetratio.Text: Minimum normal vector angle of lines to be found. The origin of the normal vectors is located on the left in the middle of image.
Maximum normal vector angle of lines to be found. The origin of the normal vectors is located on the left in the middle of image.
Minimal distance of lines to be found.
Minimal distance of lines to be found.
Minimal distance of lines to be found.
Start of line search in X. Effects only at equal line lengths

Precitec.Filter.PoorPenetrationMulti.Bes.Text: Looking for zones of Poor Penetration

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.PoorPenetratio.Text: Upper threshold to determine the contrast
Greylevel distance between the neighborhood pixles
Amount of pixels above the upper threshold beneath a minimum
Amount of pixels above the upper threshold
Amount of pixels above the upper threshold
Amount of pixels above the upper threshold
Amount of pixels below the lower threshold beneath a minimum
Amount of pixels below the lower threshold
Amount of pixels below the lower threshold
Amount of pixels below the lower threshold
Filter in x direction for the computation of then grey level profile
Filter in y direction for the computation of the grey level profile
Resolution in y direction for the computation of the minima
Allowed x distance between the minima to represent a gap
Maximal Interruption for a minimum chain

Precitec.Filter.ImageExtremum.Beschreibu.Text: This filter finds the maximum or minimum of am image.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.ImageExtremum..Text: Find maximum (light pixel) or minimum(dark pixel)
Mode: 0) Simple search 1) Subpixel position (4 neighbours interpolation)

Precitec.Filter.CrossCorrelationDynamicT.Text: This filter computes the cross-correlation of an image (first input) with a template(second input). The correlation method used can be cross-correlation or normed cross-correlation. The output is the computed image. The intensity range of both output images is always rescaled between 0-255 (also in the case of normed cross-correlation, otherwise it would not be possible to represent the range 0-1 - see parameters for the percentage of the output range). The filter does not perform any padding on the input image, therefore the size of the output image will be smaller than the input image with a difference of (template size - 1), and the image position is changed such that the output image is centered. The option 'Fill Output Border' is given in order to return an image with the same size as the input. In case of error (for example pattern image not valid), a blank image with size (0,0) is returned.

Precitec.Filter.StartEndMisalignmentDete.Text: Filter that detects the start or the end of the workpiece in an image and computes the misalignment between the left and the right edge. The left and right edge can be detected also when in consecutive images. INPUT 1: Image INPUT 2 : Direction (typically provided by the SeamConstant filter). If the background position does not agree with the provided direction (i.e. if direction is from above, in the start image the background should appear on top) the start-end recongition is stopped. Special: value -99 bypass the detection OUTPUT 1: Start-end info, can be used with the start-end roi filter OUTPUT 2: Misalignment at start [mm]. Difference between the edge left and right in the start images (rank 255), in the other images the output is 0 (rank 0). OUTPUT 3: Misalignment at end [mm]. Difference between the edge left and right in the end images (rank 255), in the other images the output is 0 (rank 0). OUTPUT 4: Workpiece length [mm]. Distance between the last image and the first image of the workpiece, independently from the edge recognition. OUTPUT 5: Quality: 1 if both start and end recognition have been found in the seam

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.StartEndMisali.Text: ROI Offset at the start edge. A positive value will decrease the valid area away from the detected edge.
ROI Offset at the end edge. A positive value will decrease the valid area away from the detected edge. With the value -2000 this parameter is automatically set equal to Offset Start
ROI Offset at the right and left side.
Only the selected edges are searched for.
Number of images to check at the beginning and end of the seam
Number of images to check at the beginning and end of the seam

Precitec.Filter.NotchSize.Beschreibung.Text: Notch Size. INPUT 1: image INPUT 2: start end info (from StartEndMisalignment filter) INPUT 3: Coordinate x of left border of the seam INPUT 4: Coordinate x of right border of the seam OUTPUT 1: Notch size at start [mm] OUTPUT 2: Notch size at end [mm]

Precitec.Filter.CircleHough.Beschreibung.Text: Circle Hough. Detect circles in an image using the Hough transform. Input 1: image; Input 2: minimum radius; Input 3: maximum radius. Output 1: center x Output 2: center y Output 3: radius

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleHough.Nu.Text: Number of candidates for each radius

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleHough.Sc.Text: Hough Threshold (-1 return only best match, >= 0 return all candidates above threshold)
Hough Threshold (-1 only best match, >= 0 all above threshold)

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleHough.Se.Text: Search circles with center outside ROI
Search circles with center outside ROI

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.CircleHough.Sc.Text: Score Type: accumulator matrix score or connected arc length

Precitec.Filter.AdjustContrast.Beschreib.Text: Kontrast anpassen. Lineare LUT oder Binarisieren mit die 2 Eingang-Schwellen.

Precitec.Filter.StartEndROIChecker.Besch.Text: Verification if ROI is completely on material. Output: Completely on material: 1, Otherwise: 0. Verbosity: Low: draw roi if it is not fully on blank; at least Medium: draw roi everytime.

Precitec.Filter.Stencil.Beschreibung.Text: The sencil filter masks the areas of an image that have the value 0 in the binary mask image.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Stencil.MaskFi.Text: Mask filename and location relative to Weldmaster installation folder
